propertyDescription: This thoughtfully designed apartment maximizes every square meter of its 96m² footprint across three bedrooms and two full bathrooms. The master bedroom offers ample space for a king-size bed with built-in wardrobes providing generous storage. Two additional bedrooms can accommodate family members or guests, with one easily serving as a home office for remote workers. The open-plan living area creates a social hub connecting the lounge and dining space, enhanced by large windows that flood the interior with natural light. A separate kitchen provides dedicated cooking space with room for modern appliances and storage. The private terrace extends your living space outdoors, perfect for morning coffee or evening dining under the Spanish stars. Both bathrooms feature contemporary fittings, with the main bathroom offering a full bath and the second providing convenient shower facilities. Throughout the property, practical features like ceiling fans, fitted wardrobes, and quality flooring demonstrate attention to comfort and functionality. The community pool area offers a resort-style setting for relaxation and socializing with neighbors.

locationSection.title: Living in Torrevieja: Your Costa Blanca Lifestyle
locationSection.content: Torrevieja stands out among Costa Blanca destinations for its authentic Spanish character combined with international appeal. Unlike purely tourist-focused resorts, this working town of 80,000 residents provides year-round services, healthcare, and cultural activities. The famous pink and green salt lakes create a unique landscape and contribute to the area's beneficial microclimate. Torrevieja's extensive coastline features a variety of beaches from bustling Playa del Cura to the quieter Playa de la Mata. The town center buzzes with traditional Spanish life - morning markets, afternoon siestas, and evening paseos along the waterfront. International residents from across Europe have created a welcoming expat community while preserving the town's Spanish essence. Excellent transport links via the AP-7 autopista connect you to Alicante Airport in 45 minutes and Valencia in 90 minutes. The presence of a modern hospital, international schools, and major supermarket chains makes Torrevieja equally suitable for permanent residence or extended holidays.

investmentSection: Torrevieja's rental market remains robust throughout the year, supported by both summer holidaymakers and winter residents from Northern Europe. Three-bedroom properties with pools command premium rental rates, typically achieving €500-700 per week during peak summer months and €300-450 during shoulder seasons. Annual rental yields of 5-7% are achievable with active management, while long-term rentals to year-round expat residents provide steady income of €600-800 monthly. Torrevieja's established infrastructure and continued development projects, including marina expansions and beach improvements, support property values. The €245,000 price point represents excellent value compared to similar coastal locations in France or Italy, while Spain's Golden Visa program attracts international investment. Recent market data shows Torrevieja properties have recovered strongly from previous downturns, with steady 3-5% annual appreciation expected as Costa Blanca remains Europe's preferred sunshine destination.
lifestyleSection: Your typical day begins with coffee on your private terrace, enjoying Mediterranean sunshine that graces Torrevieja over 320 days annually. A short walk brings you to the morning market where local vendors offer fresh produce, regional specialties, and the daily catch from Torrevieja's fishing fleet. Afternoons might find you lounging by the community pool with a good book, or exploring the unique pink salt lakes where flamingos gather seasonally. Evenings come alive along the waterfront promenade, where Spanish families enjoy their traditional paseo and waterfront restaurants serve everything from authentic paella to international cuisine. The nearby marina offers boat trips, fishing excursions, or simply peaceful sunset viewing. Weekend adventures easily reach Alicante's historic castle, Elche's UNESCO palm groves, or the dramatic mountains of inland Alicante province. Throughout it all, Torrevieja's welcoming international community provides instant social connections while maintaining the authentic Spanish character that makes Costa Blanca living so appealing.

faqs.question: What community fees apply to this Torrevieja apartment?
faqs.answer: Community fees typically range €40-80 monthly for properties of this size in Torrevieja, covering pool maintenance, common area cleaning, building insurance, and landscaping. We'll confirm exact amounts during viewing arrangements.

faqs.question: How close are the beaches to this property?
faqs.answer: Playa del Cura, Torrevieja's main central beach, is approximately 800 meters away - an easy 8-10 minute walk. Multiple beach options including Playa de la Mata and Playa de los Náufragos are all within 2km.

faqs.question: Is the parking space included in the €245,000 price?
faqs.answer: Yes, the dedicated parking space is included in the purchase price, which represents excellent value as parking can be challenging in central Torrevieja locations during peak seasons.

faqs.question: What financing options exist for UK buyers?
faqs.answer: Spanish banks typically offer mortgages up to 70% for non-residents, with competitive rates currently around 3-4%. We work with mortgage brokers specializing in Costa Blanca purchases and can arrange pre-approval consultations.

faqs.question: When would this apartment be available for viewing?

faqs.question: How long does the Spanish property purchase process take?
faqs.answer: From offer acceptance to completion typically takes 6-10 weeks, including legal checks, mortgage arrangements if needed, and final signing at the Spanish notary. We'll guide you through each step with English-speaking legal support.

faqs.answer: Torrevieja continues investing in infrastructure improvements including beach enhancements and marina expansions. No negative developments are planned for this residential area, with the town maintaining its established character while improving amenities.
